Television|Warner Horizon Television]] | country = United States | distributor = [[MTV]] | preceded_by = [[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 4)|Season 4]] | followed_by = [[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 6)|Season 6]][http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2010/11/22/mtv-renews-americas-best-dance-crew-for-sixth-season-premieres-in-april-2011/73040] | network = [[MTV]] (U.S.)
[[MuchMusic]] (Canada) }} The fifth season of ''[[America's Best Dance Crew]]'' premiered on January 28, 2010 and concluded on April 8, 2010. Auditions were held in six cities from November 20 through December 12: Atlanta, Houston, Denver, Los Angeles, Boston, and New York.[http://bloggingbestdancecrew.blogspot.com/2009/10/abdc-5-auditions-all-info.html "ABDC 5 Auditions – all the info!"] [[Blogspot]]; October 27, 2009 Audition callbacks were held the day after auditions, with evaluations by the TV show judges and members of past ''ABDC champions''.[http://bloggingbestdancecrew.blogspot.com/2009/11/abdc-audition-changes-for-season-5-crew.html "ABCD Audition changes for Season 5: crew size, callbacks with ABCD alums!"] Blogspot; November 16, 2009 The first three episodes of the season featured auditions from each region: South, East, and West.[http://bloggingbestdancecrew.blogspot.com/2009/12/abdc-season-5-selection-process-new-and.html "ABDC Season 5 selection process – new and improved over past seasons!"] Blogspot; December 14, 2009 [[Shane Sparks]] did not return as a judge this season, due to his arrest, and was replaced by [[Omarion]].[http://blog.muchmusic.com/omarion-named-as-the-new-judge-for-abdc/ "Omarion named as the new judge for ABDC"] MuchMusic; January 19, 2010 In the live finale, [[Poreotics|Poreotix]] was declared the winner of Season 5 and received the $100,000 ([[United States dollar|USD]]) prize. ==Crews== A dance crew became eligible to compete either through the live audition process or through submission of an audition video. In either case, each crew had to prepare and perform an original routine lasting one or two minutes. The audition judges selected several of the crews for callbacks, and presented them with another challenge; each dance crew was given music and told to choreograph another group routine, followed by a series of short individual freestyles. The following day, these crews performed their two routines in front of a small panel of judges. After another set of callbacks, the remaining crews performed their original audition routines in front of an ''ABDC'' "celebrity panel". These judges would then decide whether the crew would move onto the Regional competition. So far, there are no midwest regionals.

1}}: No crews were eliminated due to voting errors. |}
==Performances== *Starting from the Final 5, when a crew gets eliminated, they take a look back at the eliminated crew's journey on the show while playing "[[Doesn't Mean Anything]]" by [[Alicia Keys]]. ===Regionals: South=== *Aired on January 28, 2010 The five Southern regional crews, selected by Lil Mama, JC Chasez, and guest judge [[Hokuto "Hok" Konishi]] from [[Quest Crew]], performed to a song of their choice. The bottom three were chosen by the judges and danced in a battle for 30 seconds each to a mastermix of "[[Outta Control]]" by [[Baby Bash]] featuring [[Pitbull (rapper)|Pitbull]]. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Song[http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2010/01/27/abdc-week-one-regional-music-get-cha-swerve-on/ Regionals: South Song List] |- | Jungle Boogie | "[[Genesis (Busta Rhymes album)|Bounce]]" by [[Busta Rhymes]] |- | Ghost | "Android Porn" by Kraddy |- | X-treme Motion | "[[She Ain't Got...]]" by [[LeToya Luckett]] |- | Swagger Crew | "[[Ice Cream Paint Job]]" by [[Dorrough]] |- | Royal Flush | "[[Wasted (Gucci Mane song)|Wasted]]" by [[Gucci Mane]] featuring [[Plies]] |} *'''Safe:''' Swagger Crew, Jungle Boogie *'''Bottom 3:''' X-treme Motion, Royal Flush, Ghost *'''Eliminated:''' Ghost, X-treme Motion ===Regionals: East=== *Aired on February 4, 2010 The five Eastern regional crews, selected by Lil Mama and guest judge Kevin "Keibee" Brewer from the [[JabbaWockeeZ]], performed to a song of their choice. The bottom three were chosen by the judges and danced in a battle for 30 seconds each to a mastermix of "[[Hip Hop Is Dead (song)|Hip Hop Is Dead]]" by [[Nas]] featuring [[will.i.am]]. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Song[http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2010/02/03/abdc-week-two-songlist-east-plans-to-shine/ Regionals: East Song List] |- | Legendary Seven | "[[I Can Transform Ya]]" by [[Chris Brown (American singer)|Chris Brown]] featuring [[Lil Wayne]] & [[Swizz Beatz]] |- | draZtik | "Shattered Glass" by [[Britney Spears]] |- | Blueprint Cru | "Feel On It" by [[Bishop Lamont]] |- | Static Noyze | "[[On to the Next One]]" by [[Jay-Z]] featuring [[Swizz Beatz]] |- | Saltare | "I'mma Shine" by [[YoungBloodZ]] |} *'''Safe:''' Saltare, Blueprint Cru *'''Bottom 3:''' draZtik, Legendary Seven, Static Noyze *'''Eliminated:''' Legendary Seven, draZtik ===Regionals: West=== *Aired on February 11, 2010 The five Western regional crews, selected by Omarion, JC Chasez, and guest judge Nichelle Thrower from [[We Are Heroes]], performed to a song of their choice. The bottom three were chosen by the judges and danced in a battle for 30 seconds each to a mastermix of "[[The E.N.D.|Showdown]]" by [[The Black Eyed Peas]]. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Song[http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2010/02/10/abdc-week-three-songlist-all-eyes-on-the-west/ Regionals: West Song List] |- |- | Hype 5-0 | "[[Drop It Low]]" by [[Ester Dean]] featuring [[Chris Brown (American singer)|Chris Brown]] |- | Heavy Impact | "[[Jeremih (album)|Raindrops]]" by [[Jeremih]] |- | Blended Projekt | "[[A Man's Thoughts|Get Involved]]" by [[Ginuwine]] featuring [[Missy Elliott]] & [[Timbaland]] |- | BreakEFX | "[[Til the Casket Drops|All Eyes on Me]]" by [[Clipse]] featuring [[Keri Hilson]] |- | Poreotix | "[[Love Story (Taylor Swift song)|Love Story]]" by [[Taylor Swift]] |} *'''Safe:''' Poreotix, Heavy Impact *'''Bottom 3:''' Blended Projekt, Hype 5-0, BreakEFX *'''Eliminated:''' Blended Projekt, BreakEFX ===Week 1: Chart Topper Challenge=== *Aired on February 18, 2010 The top 9 crews each performed to a master mix of a chart-topping song. The lowest ranked crew in each region danced in a battle for 30 seconds each to a master mix of "[[Tik Tok (song)|TiK ToK]]" by [[Kesha]]. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Song[http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2010/02/16/abdc-nationals-week-one-music/ Week 1: Chart Topper Challenge Song List] |- | Hype 5-0 | "[[Imma Be]]" by [[The Black Eyed Peas]] |- | Heavy Impact | "[[Say Aah]]" by [[Trey Songz]] featuring [[Fabolous]] |- | Poreotix | "[[Day 'n' Nite]]" by [[Kid Cudi]] |- | Swagger Crew | "[[Hard (song)|Hard]]" by [[Rihanna]] featuring [[Young Jeezy]] |- | Jungle Boogie | "[[How Low (Ludacris song)|How Low]]" by [[Ludacris]] featuring [[Shawnna]] |- | Royal Flush | "[[Down (Jay Sean song)|Down]]" by [[Jay Sean]] featuring [[Lil Wayne]] |- | Saltare | "[[Hotel Room Service]]" by [[Pitbull (rapper)|Pitbull]] |- | Static Noyze | "[[Whatcha Say]]" by [[Jason DerÃ¼lo]] |- | Blueprint Cru | "[[That's Not My Name]]" by [[The Ting Tings]] |} *'''Safe:''' Poreotix, Heavy Impact, Jungle Boogie, Royal Flush, Blueprint Cru, Saltare *'''Bottom 3:''' Hype 5-0, Swagger Crew, Static Noyze *'''Eliminated:''' Swagger Crew ===Week 2: Music Video Challenge=== *Aired on February 25, 2010 The eight remaining crews emulated popular music videos from the past decade, featuring videos from artists such as [[Britney Spears]], [[Shakira]], [[Rihanna]] and ABDC's very own [[Omarion]]. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Song[http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2010/02/22/abdc-nationals-week-2-music-video-challenge/ Week 2: Music Video Challenge Song List] |- | Poreotix | "[[Umbrella (song)|Umbrella]]" by [[Rihanna]] featuring [[Jay-Z]] |- | Jungle Boogie | "[[Give It Up to Me (Shakira song)|Give It Up to Me]]" by [[Shakira]] featuring [[Lil Wayne]] |- | Static Noyze | "[[New in Town (song)|New in Town]]" by [[Little Boots]] |- | Saltare | "[[Shake It (Metro Station song)|Shake It]]" by [[Metro Station (band)|Metro Station]] |- | Heavy Impact | "[[What You Got (Colby O'Donis song)|What You Got]]" by [[Colby O'Donis]] |- | Hype 5-0 | "[[3 (song)|3]]" by [[Britney Spears]] |- | Royal Flush | "[[Evacuate the Dancefloor]]" by [[Cascada]] featuring [[Carlprit]] |- | Blueprint Cru | "[[I Get It In (Omarion song)|I Get It In]]" by [[Omarion]] featuring [[Gucci Mane]] |} *'''Safe:''' Poreotix, Jungle Boogie, Static Noyze, Saltare, Heavy Impact, Hype 5-0 *'''Bottom 2:''' Royal Flush, Blueprint Cru *'''Eliminated:''' Royal Flush ===Week 3: [[Lady GaGa]] Challenge=== *Aired on March 4, 2010 Similar to the Michael Jackson, Janet Jackson, Missy Elliott, Britney Spears, and BeyoncÃ© challenges from Seasons 1-4, the seven remaining crews performed the moves and fashion of hit songs by [[Lady Gaga]]. For the first time in ABDC history, there were no eliminations due to voting issues.[http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/showtracker/2010/03/americas-best-dance-crew-voting-problems-on-the-video-challenge.html "'America's Best Dance Crew': Voting problems on the video challenge"] L.A. Times; March 1, 2010 At the end of the episode, the judges chose the best performance to receive immunity from the double-elimination next week. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Song[http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2010/03/01/abdc-week-three-challenge-haus-of-gaga/ Week 3: Lady Gaga Challenge Song List] |- | Static Noyze | "[[Beautiful, Dirty, Rich]]" |- | Blueprint Cru | "[[Bad Romance]]" |- | Jungle Boogie | "[[Video Phone (song)|Video Phone]]" by [[BeyoncÃ© Knowles|BeyoncÃ©]] featuring Lady Gaga |- | Heavy Impact | "[[LoveGame]]" |- | Hype 5-0 | "[[Poker Face (Lady Gaga song)|Poker Face]]" |- | Poreotix | "[[Paparazzi (Lady Gaga song)|Paparazzi]]" |- | Saltare | "[[Just Dance (song)|Just Dance]]" featuring [[Colby O'Donis]] |} *'''Safe:''' Static Noyze, Blueprint Cru, Jungle Boogie, Heavy Impact, Hype 5-0, Poreotix, Saltare *'''Awarded Immunity:''' Blueprint Cru ===Week 4: Disco Challenge=== *Aired on March 11, 2010 The seven remaining crews gave classic 70's [[disco]] songs and moves a [[hip hop]] update. In addition to the challenge, all the crews had to incorporate a lift into their routines. This episode featured a double-elimination due to last week's non-elimination. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Song[http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2010/03/08/get-freaky-deaky-with-abdc-disco-week/ Week 4: Disco Challenge Song List] ! Challenge |- | Blueprint Cru | "[[Le Freak]]" by [[Chic (band)|Chic]] | "The Funky Guitar" |- | Saltare | "[[Disco Inferno]]" by [[The Trammps]] | "[[Hustle (dance)|The Hustle]]" |- | Poreotix | "[[Dancing Machine]]" by [[The Jackson 5]] | "[[Robot (dance)|The Robot]]" |- | Hype 5-0 | "Shake Your Groove Thing" by [[Peaches & Herb]] | "[[The Electric Slide]]" |- | Heavy Impact | "[[You Should Be Dancing]]" by [[Bee Gees|The Bee Gees]] | "The Strut" |- | Static Noyze | "[[A Fifth of Beethoven]]" by [[Walter Murphy]] | "The Staying Alive Finger Point" |- | Jungle Boogie | "[[Jungle Boogie]]" by [[Kool & the Gang]] | "[[Bump (dance)|The Bump]]" |} *'''Safe:''' Blueprint Cru (immune), Saltare, Poreotix, Hype 5-0 *'''Bottom 3:''' Heavy Impact, Static Noyze, Jungle Boogie *'''Eliminated:''' Heavy Impact, Static Noyze ===Week 5: [[Usher (entertainer)|Usher]] Challenge=== *Aired on March 18, 2010 Similar to the Michael Jackson, Janet Jackson, Missy Elliott, Britney Spears, and BeyoncÃ© challenges from Seasons 1-4, and the Lady Gaga challenge from earlier in the season, crews took inspiration from [[Usher (entertainer)|Usher's]] music videos. Usher himself gave each crew their challenges through a video. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Song[http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2010/03/15/this-weeks-abdc-songlist-usher-glides-into-town/ Week 5: Usher Challenge Song List] ! Challenge[http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2010/03/16/check-out-each-crews-usher-challenge-assignment/ Week 5: Usher Challenge Task List] |- | Jungle Boogie | "[[Love in This Club]]" featuring [[Young Jeezy]] | Incorporate glides into the routine. |- | Poreotix | "[[Yeah! (Usher song)|Yeah!]]" featuring [[Lil Jon]] and [[Ludacris]] | Incorporate some of Usher's moves in reverse. |- | Hype 5-0 | "[[U Don't Have to Call]]" | Start the routine with a grand entrance and incorporate choreography using [[Heelys]]. |- | Blueprint Cru | "[[Hey Daddy (Daddy's Home)]]" featuring [[Plies (rapper)|Plies]] | Incorporate a hand section that highlights one of the members in their crew. |- | Saltare | "[[Caught Up (Usher song)|Caught Up]]" | Incorporate fight choreography from the video. |} *'''Safe:''' Jungle Boogie, Poreotix, Hype 5-0 *'''Bottom 2:''' Blueprint Cru, Saltare *'''Eliminated:''' Saltare ===Week 6: Illusion Challenge=== *Aired on March 25, 2010 Just like its predecessor in [[America's Best Dance Crew (season 3)|season 3]], the remaining 4 crews incorporated an eye-popping illusion or a mind-blowing magic act into their performance set. The final 4 crews kicked off the show with a group performance to "[[Animal (Kesha album)|Take It Off]]" by [[Kesha]] with judge Lil Mama performing in the routine. Magician [[Franz Harary]] returned as the magic instructor for the crews. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Song[http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2010/03/23/this-weeks-abdc-songlist-abracadabra-tunes/ Week 6: Magic Challenge Song List] ! Challenge[http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2010/03/22/abdcs-illusion-challenge-check-out-the-crews-magical-tasks/ Week 6: Magic Challenge Task List] |- | Hype 5-0 | "[[Morning After Dark]]" by [[Timbaland]] featuring [[Nelly Furtado]] & [[SoShy]] | Make an object come to life. |- | Poreotix | "[[Right Hand Hi]]" by [[Kid Sister]] | Move an object with their minds. |- | Blueprint Cru | "[[Funhouse (song)|Funhouse]]" by [[Pink (singer)|Pink]] | Become lighter than air. |- | Jungle Boogie | "[[Rebirth (Lil Wayne album)|Da Da Da]]" by [[Lil Wayne]] | Pass their bodies through a solid surface. |} *'''Safe:''' Hype 5-0, Poreotix *'''Bottom 2:''' Blueprint Cru, Jungle Boogie *'''Eliminated:''' Jungle Boogie ===Week 7: Hip Hop Nation Challenge and Last Chance Challenge=== *Aired on April 1, 2010 This week on ABDC the crews competed against each other in two challenges: the Hip Hop Nation Challenge and the Last Chance Challenge. For both challenges, the crews got to collaborate with producer [[Swizz Beatz]]. ====Challenge #1: Hip Hop Nation Challenge==== The remaining 3 crews displayed mastery of hip hop styles from around the nation. One crew was given the boot halfway through the show. The crews received help from three guest ABDC alumni from past seasons. Each alumnus was assigned to one of the dance styles the crews will be responsible for. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Song[http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2010/03/29/this-weeks-abdc-songlist-hip-hop-nation/ Week 7: Hip Hop Nation Challenge Song List] ! Style ! Guest |- | "[[Blow the Whistle (song)|Blow The Whistle]]" by [[Too Short]] | [[Turfing|Turfin']] | Mitch Sanedrin from [[Supreme Soul]] |- | "[[Lil Jon discography|I'm The Ish]]" by DJ Class featuring [[Lil Jon]] | [[Baltimore club|Baltimore House]] | PorchÃ© Anthony from Beat Ya Feet Kings |- | "[[Get Me Bodied]]" by [[BeyoncÃ© Knowles|BeyoncÃ©]] | [[Bounce music|New Orleans Bounce]] | Riquel Olander from [[We Are Heroes]] |} *'''Safe:''' Blueprint Cru *'''Bottom 2:''' Poreotix, Hype 5-0 *'''Eliminated:''' Hype 5-0 ====Challenge #2: Last Chance Challenge==== The crews created original beats with [[Swizz Beatz]] to groove to during their routine for the Last Chance Challenge to show America why ''they'' should be crowned the winner. The remaining two crews then performed their prepared routines before the lines opened for the final voting session of the season. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crew ! Performance Title |- | Blueprint Cru | Come To Life |- | Poreotix | Tetreotix |} ===Week 8: The Live Finale=== *Aired on April 8, 2010 The eliminated crews of season 5 returned and teamed up with the remaining two crews for a regional collaboration each song by a different regional artist. Each judge said their opinion on the crews of their region while judging at their region for auditions. West for Omarion, East for Lil Mama, and South for JC Chasez. Instead of going head-to-head, Poreotix and Blueprint Cru teamed up for their last performance. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Crews ! Song[http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2010/04/06/abdc-finale-week-songlist-regional-performances/ Week 8: The Live Finale Song List] |- | '''West:''' Poreotix, Hype 5-0, and Heavy Impact | "[[Blah Blah Blah (song)|Blah Blah Blah]]" by [[Kesha]] |- | '''East:''' Blueprint Cru, Saltare, and Static Noyze | "[[Hot Mess (song)|Hot Mess]]" by [[Cobra Starship]] |- | '''South:''' Jungle Boogie, Royal Flush, and Swagger Crew | "[[Take Your Shirt Off]]" by [[T-Pain]] |- | Poreotix and Blueprint Cru | [[Winter Guard International|Pulse Percussion]] |- | Poreotix |"[[I Made It (Cash Money Heroes)|I Made It]]" by [[Kevin Rudolf]] featuring [[Birdman (rapper)|Birdman]], [[Jay Sean]] & [[Lil Wayne]] |} On April 8, 2010, [[Poreotics|Poreotix]] was crowned the winner of '''America's Best Dance Crew Season 5''', while Blueprint Cru was declared the runner-up. *'''Winner:''' Poreotix *'''Runner-up:''' Blueprint Cru ===Special Episode: Champions for Charity=== *Aired on April 15, 2010 This week, ABDC had a charity event featuring all five ABDC champions. The five champions opened up the show with a group performance to "[[All I Do Is Win]]" by [[DJ Khaled]]. {|class="wikitable" |- !Season !Winner !Song[http://remotecontrol.mtv.com/2010/04/12/this-weeks-abdc-songlist-the-long-awaited-champion-episode/ Special Episode: Champions for Charity Song List] !Charity |- |[[ABDC1|Season 1]] |[[JabbaWockeeZ]] | "[[The Final Countdown (song)|The Final Countdown]]" by [[Europe (band)|Europe]] and "Robot Remains" by The Bangerz |Less Than Four |- |[[ABDC2|Season 2]] |[[Super Cr3w]] | "[[ABCs (song)|ABCs]]" by [[K'naan]] |Marvelous Connections |- |[[ABDC3|Season 3]] |[[Quest Crew]] | "[[Sing, Sing, Sing (With a Swing)|Sing, Sing, Sing]]" by [[Swing Kids]] |Say It Loud |- |[[ABDC4|Season 4]] |[[We Are Heroes]] | "[[Rock That Body]]" by [[The Black Eyed Peas]] |The Sparkle Effect |- |[[ABDC5|Season 5]] |[[Poreotics|Poreotix]] | "[[Witch Doctor (song)|Witch Doctor]]" by [[Alvin and the Chipmunks]] |Everybody Dance Now |} ==References== {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{succession box|title=''[[America's Best Dance Crew]]''|before=[[America's Best Dance Crew (Season 4)|Season 4]]|after=[[America's Best Dance Crew (season 6)|Season 6]]|years='''''Season 5'''''}} {{s-end}} ==External links== * {{official website|http://www.mtv.com/ontv/dyn/dance_crew/series.jhtml}} {{America's Best Dance Crew}} [[Category:2010 television seasons]] [[Category:Dance competitions]] [[no:America's Best Dance Crew (sesong 5)]]
